title: Nagaon Beach
subtitle: A Water Sports Paradise Near Alibaug
overview: Nagaon Beach, located about 9 km from Alibaug in the Raigad district, is one of the most popular beaches on the Konkan coast. Known for its wide stretch of golden sand and clean waters, Nagaon attracts families, groups, and adventure lovers throughout the year.
The beach is famous for thrilling water sports such as parasailing, banana rides, jet skiing, and bumper rides. With its proximity to Mumbai and Pune, it serves as a perfect weekend getaway.
Surrounded by coconut and betel nut trees, the beach also offers charming homestays and seafood eateries that reflect authentic coastal hospitality.

highlights.title: Adventure Water Sports
highlights.description: From jet skiing to banana rides, Nagaon Beach offers a full range of water adventure activities.

highlights.title: Clean & Spacious Shoreline
highlights.description: Golden sand and shallow waters make it ideal for family picnics and long walks.

highlights.title: Homestay Experience
highlights.description: Numerous comfortable homestays and resorts located near the beach provide a true Konkan stay experience.

geography.intro: Nagaon Beach lies on the western coast of Maharashtra, just 9 km from Alibaug, surrounded by lush coconut groves and paddy fields.

climate.description: Nagaon enjoys a humid coastal climate with moderate to warm temperatures all year round.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to May

geography.conclusion: Its pleasant weather and proximity to Mumbai make Nagaon Beach one of the most visited destinations on the Konkan coast.

activities.title: Water Sports
activities.description: Enjoy thrilling activities such as parasailing, jet skiing, banana rides, and bumper rides.
info: Available through local operators on the beach
Safety gear provided for all participants

activities.title: Photography & Sunset View
activities.description: Capture breathtaking sunsets and scenic views across the vast Arabian Sea horizon.

activities.title: Seafood Tasting
activities.description: Savor fresh seafood delicacies at beachside shacks and local homestays.
info: Must-try: Fish thali and prawns curry
Plenty of hygienic eateries near the beach

attractions.title: Kolaba Fort
attractions.description: Historic sea fort accessible during low tide from Alibaug Beach, known for Maratha architecture.

attractions.title: Kihim Beach
attractions.description: A scenic and quieter beach located nearby, known for its flora and birdlife.

attractions.title: Revdanda Fort
attractions.description: Ruins of a Portuguese-era fort located right by the sea, offering stunning views.

marineLife.intro: Nagaon’s nearshore marine life is relatively simple, consisting mainly of small fish, crabs, and seashells that thrive in the sandy seabed.

items.title: Small Coastal Fish
items.description: Commonly spotted in shallow waters along the beach.

items.title: Shells & Starfish
items.description: Visitors often find small shells and starfish along the tide line during low tide.

conclusion: Nagaon Beach maintains a clean marine ecosystem thanks to local community efforts.
Visitors are encouraged to avoid littering and maintain beach cleanliness.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Nagaon is well-connected by road — 110 km from Mumbai and 120 km from Pune.
Regular buses and private taxis are available from Alibaug and Mumbai.

howToReach.title: By Ferry
details: Ferries from Gateway of India to Mandwa Jetty operate daily.
From Mandwa, Nagaon is just 20 km away by road (taxis and buses available).

howToReach.title: By Train
details: From Pen, local buses and cabs connect to Alibaug and Nagaon.

gallery.alt: Golden sand stretch of Nagaon Beach

bookingTips.description: Choose beachfront homestays or resorts for a better view and quick beach access.
Book water sports early, especially on weekends.
Carry cash as smaller stalls and rides often do not accept digital payments.
